meanings.definition: The quality or state of being disciplined.
meanings.sent1: Her disciplinarity in following rules impressed her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The school principal emphasized the importance of disciplinarity in achieving success.
meanings.sent3: The cat's disciplinarity in catching mice made it the star of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His disciplinarity in time management was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The disciplinarity of the soldier's training was evident in every precise movement.

meanings.definition: The field of study or knowledge within a specific academic discipline.
meanings.sent1: The university offers a wide range of courses to explore different areas of disciplinarity.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in the field of psychology often discuss the importance of interdisciplinarity.
meanings.sent3: The conference on disciplinarity brought together experts from various academic fields.
meanings.sent4: In the world of science, the disciplinarity of physics and chemistry often overlap.
meanings.sent5: The professor's deep understanding of disciplinarity was evident in his comprehensive lectures.
